metadata.title: Yeast Kexlp Is a Golgi-associated Membrane Protein: Deletions in a Cytoplasmic Targeting Domain Result in Mislocalization to the Vacuolar Membrane

abstract.original_text: We have investigated the localization of Kexlp, a type I transmembrane carboxypeptidase involved in precursor processing within the yeast secretory pathway. Indirect immunofluorescence demonstrated the presence of Kexlp in a punctate organelle resembling the yeast Golgi apparatus as identified by Kex2p and Sec7p (Franzusoff, A., K. Redding, J. Crosby, R. S. Fuller, and R. Schekman. 1991. J. Cell Biol. 112:27-37). Glycosylation studies of Kexlp were consistent with a Golgi location, as Kexlp was progressively N-glycosylated in an MNNl-dependent manner.

sentences.segment_text: We have investigated the localization of Kexlp ,
a type I transmembrane carboxypeptidase involved in precursor processing within the yeast secretory pathway .

Indirect immunofluorescence demonstrated the presence of Kexlp in a punctate organelle resembling the yeast Golgi apparatus as identified by Kex2p and Sec7p ( Franzusoff , A. , K. Redding , J. Crosby , R. S. Fuller , and R. Schekman .
Glycosylation studies of Kexlp were consistent with a Golgi location ,
as Kexlp was progressively N-glycosylated in an MNNl-dependent manner .

abstract.original_text: To address the basis of Kexlp targeting to the Golgi apparatus, we examined the cellular location of a series of carboxy-terminal truncations of the protein.

sentences.segment_text: To address the basis of Kexlp targeting to the Golgi apparatus ,
we examined the cellular location of a series of carboxy-terminal truncations of the protein .

abstract.original_text: The results indicate that a cytoplasmically exposed carboxy-terminal domain is required for retention of this membrane protein within the Golgi apparatus. Deletions of the retention region or overproduction of wild-type Kexlp led to mislocalization of Kexlp to the vacuolar membrane. This unexpected finding is discussed in terms of models involving either the vacuole as a default destination for membrane proteins, or by endocytosis to the vacuole following their default localization to the plasma membrane.

sentences.segment_text: The results indicate that a cytoplasmically exposed carboxy-terminal domain is required for retention of this membrane protein within the Golgi apparatus .

This unexpected finding is discussed in terms of models involving either the vacuole as a default destination for membrane proteins ,
or by endocytosis to the vacuole following their default localization to the plasma membrane .
